content.description: Start either directly up the smooth insecure ramp to the high first bolt or traverse in right from the beginning of Highbrow. After passing this bolt, mantel onto the ledge and enjoy the rest before the hard climbing starts. Locate a series of small crimps and bad feet to clip the 2nd bolt and continue up to the overhanging wall. Make several more moves on to the patinaed face to the next bolt. Head right to the large crack and head towards the anchors. Arguably the best route at the crag.
content.location: Left bolted line of Master Link.

content.description: Begin up the easily protected hand crack before awkwardly manteling to the face, protect the move to the 2nd bolt with a small-medium cam in the horizontal and make the fun cruxy moves onto tiny painful crimps and side pulls to nice patinas to the top. A stout, but extremely enjoyable route.
content.protection: 3 bolts, small to medium gear, chain anchors.

content.description: A steep finger and hand crack.

Start up a thin and polished crack before heading into an offwidth halfway up the route. Either head right up a wider crack or left up a hand crack to the top. An older set of anchors exist on top next to the shiny new ones suggesting this was the first route done at the Missing Link.
content.location: Middle crack of the south face.

content.description: Head up the steep arete past a few horizontals.
content.location: Right arete of the south face.

content.description: Shares a beginning with The Straddler, then heads up moderate climbing past the first two bolts. After standing up to clip the 3rd bolt the real fun begins. A large committing move onto the overhanging patinas will leave you fighting with momentum and gravity to keep your feet on the wall. Clip the last bolt and make the final steep moves to an easy crack to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts, small to medium cams, chain anchors.
content.location: Left most bolted line on the south face.

content.description: Begin off the ground into two parallel cracks, passing the small roof is the crux, patinas and crack lead to the anchors.
content.protection: to 3", chain anchors to the right of the crack.

content.description: Begin up the crack (optional pro), before getting established on the ledge and clipping the first bolt. A series of technical moves will lead you to the next ledge and a tricky sequence from here gets you to the easy climbing to the anchors. A great sustained climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts, optional small cams, chain anchors, rap off to save rope.
